statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Your task is very simple. You will get the coordinates of n points in a plane. It is guaranteed that there are no three points on a straight line. You can choose any four points from these points to construct a quadrangle. Now, please tell me how many convex quadrangles you can construct.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The first line of input contain an integer z (z �� 20), indicating the number of test cases.
For each test case, the first line contain an integer n (4 �� n �� 700), indicating the number of points. Each of the next n lines contains two integers x and y (-1000000 �� x, y �� 1000000), indicating the coordinate of corresponding point.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, just output a single integer, the number of convex quadrangles you can construct.

statement.title: Source
statement.content: 2010 Asia Regional Tianjin Site ���� Online Contest
